title: Voting guide: Here’s what voters need to know before Boston’s Tuesday election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston polls will operate from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. across 275 precincts on Tuesday.
Mayor Michelle Wu is unopposed; key contested races include four at-large and several district council seats.
Voters have language support in English, Spanish, Chinese, Vietnamese, Haitian Creole, Cape Verdean, Russian, and Portuguese.

title: The Bruins’ second line is looking like a difference-maker, in more ways than one
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins' second line of Casey Mittelstadt, Pavel Zacha, and Viktor Arvidsson drives offensive play in recent games.
Coach Marco Sturm uses benching strategy effectively, with Mittelstadt rebounding after removal to boost team performance.
Boston's second line has scored 4-2 against opponents, demonstrating key dynamics amid top line challenges without Elias Lindholm.

title: Garrett Crochet, Roman Anthony named finalist for Cy Young, Rookie of the Year Awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Garrett Crochet is a finalist for the AL Cy Young Award after leading with 205.1 innings and 255 strikeouts.
Crochet achieved an 18-5 record and a 2.59 ERA in his first season with the Boston Red Sox.
Roman Anthony is a finalist for the AL Rookie of the Year Award, batting .292 with 8 home runs in 71 games.

title: Ranking top priorities for Patriots at NFL trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots aim to improve their pass-rush unit by seeking an additional edge rusher before the trade deadline.
With Antonio Gibson injured, the Patriots are exploring acquiring a running back to bolster depth alongside TreVeyon Henderson.
The Patriots are considering enhancing their secondary and wide receiver corps, despite already strong performances this season.

title: Patriots’ pass-protection issues are mounting as Drake Maye ties worrisome stat from last year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots' offensive line has allowed 34 sacks this season, ranking second-most in the NFL.
Quarterback Drake Maye has matched last season's sack total despite playing four fewer games.
Center Garrett Bradbury emphasizes the need for improved pass protection to avoid predictable passing situations.

title: Downtown Boston hotel settles discrimination complaint after woman was accused of being a man
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Liberty Hotel in Boston settled a discrimination complaint after a woman was wrongly accused of being a man.
The Massachusetts Commission Against Discrimination and Liberty Hotel agreed on policy updates and a $10,000 charitable donation.
The woman's lawyer plans to file a civil lawsuit seeking punitive damages against the hotel and its executives.

title: Falcons coach walks back ‘clapgate’ accusations after Patriots push back
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Falcons coach Raheem Morris retracted claims that Patriots simulated snap counts after losing 24-23 to New England.
Morris initially suggested Patriots mimicked Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr.'s clapping, leading to an early snap and penalty.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel dismissed accusations, stating he didn't witness any defensive simulation of snap counts.

title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman opts out of his Red Sox contract, entering free agency with two years and $80 million left.
Bregman, 32, slashed .273/.360/.462 with 18 home runs and 62 RBIs in 114 games during the 2025 season.
Red Sox may attempt to retain Bregman; Tigers and Mariners also potential suitors for the veteran third baseman.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots consider roster upgrades before the NFL trade deadline, aiming to improve on their 7-2 season.
Potential trade targets for New England include wide receiver Jaylen Waddle and edge rushers like Trey Hendrickson.
The team has been involved in discussions about moving linebacker Anfernee Jennings to create space for new acquisitions.

title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm returns to the Bruins lineup after recovering from a lower-body injury, stabilizing their defensive performance.
Lindholm and his fiancée Amanda welcomed their first child, Magnolia, named after Amanda's favorite tree.
Bruins are 5-1-0 when Lindholm plays, contrasting a 2-6-0 record without him due to his key defensive role.
